decision_conditions: It is recommended that these three trees, that are identified on the applicant plan can be felled, this property is within the Havering-Atte-Bower Conservation Area, and the trees are situated to the western flank of Blue Boar Hall.
Tree X, this juniper is a poor specimen with considerable dead with in the crown and has a very poor form.
Tree Y, Pine tree this tree is on the edge of  a defunct pond with exposed root buttress, the tree has bifurcated stems with a strong likely hood of them splinting out and failing.

Tree Z, Robinia, this tree has a 45 degree lean towards the property, on inspection it was found that the main tree stem has extensive rot and is very likely to fail in the near future, with the potential of causing structural damage to the property.

It is suggested that you engage the services of a qualified and fully insured tree surgeon to carry out the above work on your behalf (you should ask to see the contractor's insurance certificate and make sure that it is up to date).

Please note that if the work for which consent is granted is not carried out within 2 years of the date of this letter, it will be necessary to submit a fresh application if it is intended to implement the work.
description:
Removal of the following trees to the side of the existing garage
Tree X
Junipa - poor specimen with some dead branches and some dead leaves - site of future extension so would like it removed now
Tree Y
Fir tree  - split trunk from near the base - in too close proximity to the garage with branches overhanging -  site of future extension so would like it removed now
Tree Z
Rubinia  - heavily leaning and previously proppoed - with one trunk with rotten interior right to the core - with branches overhanging the roof garage which is thought to be the oldest part of this Grade 2 listed house and  we fear than in future it may fall
